result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Steven Lee Kelly Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution and restitution surcharge in an amount to be determined within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment recommended within 30 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall abide by all the rules of Probation & Parole.  this agreement may be revoked if the defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole, regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Defendant to maintain full time employment in an occupation acceptable to agent and not quit current employment without agent approval.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in own name and take exactly as directed to be taken.  

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages; no entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

Obey all no contact orders per agent.

Follow all rules and recommendations made by agent.

To be booked into jail no later than December 14, 2015 by close of business.  To go immediately after hearing to make arrangements.  

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes:
With work release/EMP.
To report January 18, 2016 by Noon.
